articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol will address the nation on Saturday morning, his office said, ahead of a planned impeachment vote over his attempt this week to impose martial law.
articles.title: South Korea President Yoon to address nation ahead of impeachment vote

articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi, Timour Azhari
articles.description: Syrian rebels said they seized control of the southern city of Daraa on Saturday, the birthplace of a 2011 uprising against President Bashar al-Assad and the fourth city his forces have lost in a week.
articles.title: Syrian rebels seize fourth city, close in on Homs in threat to Assad's rule

articles.author: Luiza Ilie
articles.description: Thousands of people rallied in the Romanian capital Bucharest late on Thursday in support of democracy ahead of a Sunday presidential election runoff that could see a far-right critic of the EU defeat a pro-European centrist candidate.
articles.title: Thousands attend pro-European rally in Romania ahead of presidential run-off vote

articles.author: Brendan Pierson
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court agreed on Friday to decide the legality of a 2019 federal statute meant to facilitate lawsuits against Palestinian authorities by Americans killed or injured in attacks in Israel and elsewhere.
articles.title: US Supreme Court to weigh bid to sue Palestinian authorities over attacks

articles.author: Maxwell Adombila, Christian Akorlie
articles.description: Ghana holds a presidential and parliamentary election on Saturday amid hopes for an economic revival after the worst financial crisis in a generation, which led to a major debt default in the West African nation.
articles.title: Ghana holds election amid hopes for better economic times

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Clashes broke out between police and protesters in Athens on Friday after thousands marched to mark the 16th anniversary of the police killing of a teenage boy, whose death triggered Greece's worst riots in decades.
articles.title: Clashes break out in Athens after march to mark 2008 student killing by police

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexico is doing everything it can to protect a regional trade agreement with the U.S. and Canada, the Latin American nation's deputy economy minister said in an interview published on Friday.
articles.title: Mexico doing all it can to protect trade agreement with US, Canada, official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Notre-Dame Cathedral reopens after fire destroyed its roof and spire and caused major damage.
articles.title: Notre-Dame Cathedral reopens on Saturday. Here's what to know

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Burkina Faso's ruling junta has dismissed interim Prime Minister Apollinaire Joachim Kyelem de Tambela and dissolved the government, a decree issued by the office of military leader Ibrahim Traore said on Friday.
articles.title: Burkina Faso junta fires prime minister, dissolves government

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Paris' Notre-Dame Cathedral reopens on Saturday, Dec. 7, five and a half years after fire destroyed its roof and spire and caused major damage throughout.
articles.title: Notre-Dame Cathedral reopens on Saturday. Here's what to know
